titlestmt.titleproper: San Antonio and Aransas Pass Railway Company collection, Inclusive: 1891-1983, Bulk: 1891-1935

profiledesc.creation: Finding Aid was generated by The Texas Collection staff, using the STAR Knowledge Center for Archives (SKCA) task that automatically creates EAD files from the Archive's SKCA catalog records.

did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: San Antonio and Aransas Pass Railway Company collection
did.abstract: This collection contains photocopies of annual reports and timetables produced by the San Antonio and Aransas Pass Railway Company from the 1890's to the 1930's.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: The San Antonio and Aransas Pass Railway Company was chartered on 1884 August 28. The railroad from San Antonio to Aransas Bay, which covered a distance of 135 miles, was designed to connect San Antonio to a large, deep-water port other than Galveston.
The railroad experienced significant growth during the late 1880s, including a line from Yoakum to Waco. By 1891, the railroad boasted 688 miles of track within the state of Texas.

Due to various lawsuits and accidents, however, the San Antonio and Aransas Pass Railway Company went into receivership in 1890 July. The Southern Pacific Railroad attempted to buy control of its competitor but was sued by the Texas Railroad Commission in 1903 for attempting to own “parallel and competing lines.” By 1925, the Southern Pacific Railroad was permitted to buy the SA&AP outright.

J.O.B. Johnson, the creator and donor of this collection, spent many years collecting materials pertaining to the history of the San Antonio and Aransas Pass Railway Company. John Oscar Birgen (J.O.B.) Johnson was born in Travis County, Texas on April 18, 1911. At the age of 25, Johnson moved to Waco where he became a machinist for the Missouri-Kansas-Texas Railroad. He was also a railroad enthusiast, collecting vast amounts of personal research and serving with various historical societies including the Central Texas Chapter of the National Railway Historical Society. Johnson passed away in Waco in 1997.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection contains materials related to the operation of the San Antonio and Aransas Pass Railway Company. The documents range from 1891 to 1983, but the bulk of the materials cover the time period between 1891 and 1935.

Series I. Annual Reports is comprised exclusively of annual reports produced by the San Antonio and Aransas Pass Railway Company. Some of these documents are more generic in nature, but the majority are complex information packets submitted annually by the company to the Texas Railroad Commission. This series is the largest series in the collection.
Series II. Literary Productions consists of timetables created by the San Antonio and Aransas Pass Railway Company in addition to reports produced by the U.S. Interstate Commerce Commission.
All of the materials in the collection are photocopies obtained by donor J.O.B. Johnson and are in excellent condition.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Prior to the current round of processing, the San Antonio and Aransas Pass Railway Company collection was housed in folders with basic descriptions and dates. A detailed item-level inventory was produced at the time of donation in 1993 June.
The collection is now arranged according to material type and consists of two series: I. Annual Reports and II. Literary Productions.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: All requests for copying of materials must be submitted to The Texas Collection in writing. Please use the Request Form for Copying Materials sheet. Unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator (s) of this collection are in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

userestrict.head: Use/Re-use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: San Antonio and Aransas Pass Railway Company collection, Accession #2448, Box #, Folder #, The Texas Collection, Baylor University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Described by Thomas DeShong. Released on 2017-07-13.

did.unittitle: Annual Reports

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: Series I. Annual Reports is the largest series in the collection. It consists exclusively of annual reports produced by the San Antonio and Aransas Pass Railway Company between 1891 and 1933. Some of the annual reports are more generic, but the bulk of the materials are copies of annual report packets submitted annually by the company to the Texas Railroad Commission. The latter reports contain a wide range of information about the railroad including officers, stock, equipment, incomes, expenses, and mileage.

Literary Productions

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: Series II. Literary Productions contains decisions reported by the United States Interstate Commerce Commission, timetables created by the San Antonio and Aransas Pass Railway Company, and an article from a June 1983 issue of Texas Railroads.
